summary: The Balearic Islands are a group of islands in the Mediterranean Sea, belonging to Spain. They include Mallorca, Menorca, Ibiza, and Formentera, with Palma de Mallorca as their capital. Once part of the Kingdom of Mallorca, they are now an autonomous community with Catalan and Spanish as official languages. The islands have a Mediterranean climate and are popular tourist spots, especially Ibiza, known for its vibrant nightlife. The culture and food are similar to mainland Spain but with unique local twists.
title: Balearic Islands
